Package org.dellroad.linode.apiv4.spring

Linode v4 API Spring integration.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    LinodeApiRequestSender.AsyncExecutor
    Simplified asynchronous task execution interface.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    LinodeApiErrorHandler
    Extension of Spring's DefaultResponseErrorHandler that decodes the JSON error payload in HTTP 400 and 500 series errors so it can be included in the thrown exception.
    LinodeApiHttpRequestFactory
    Extends Spring's HttpComponentsClientHttpRequestFactory to set connection and read timeouts, setup authorization, etc.
    LinodeApiRequestSender
    Sender for Linode REST APIv4 requests.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    LinodeApiException
    Thrown when an error occurs while communicating with the Linode API.

Package org.dellroad.linode.apiv4.spring Description

Linode v4 API Spring integration.

Overview

Here are the primary classes provided:

  • LinodeApiRequestSender - Java version of the API
  • LinodeApiHttpRequestFactory - configures how HTTP requests are performed, including token authorization
  • LinodeApiException - thrown if there is an error, including a decode of the JSON error payload (if any)

XML Setup

This package comes with pre-configured Spring XML beans that you can include in your Spring application: 

     <import resource="classpath:org/dellroad/linode/apiv4/spring/linodeApi.xml"/>

The XML sets up a LinodeApiRequestSender which can be used to perform API queries: 

  import org.dellroad.linode.apiv4.model.Linode;
  import org.dellroad.linode.apiv4.request.CreateLinodeRequest;
  import org.dellroad.linode.apiv4.spring.LinodeApiHttpRequestFactory;
  import org.dellroad.linode.apiv4.spring.LinodeApiRequestSender;
  import org.springframework.beans.factory.annotation.Autowired;

  public class MyBean {

      @Autowired
      private LinodeApiRequestSender sender;

      @Autowired
      private LinodeApiHttpRequestFactory requestFactory;

      // Throws LinodeApiException if something goes wrong
      public Linode createLinode() {

          // Set authorization token (you only need to do this once)
          this.requestFactory.setAuthorizationToken("0123456789abcdef0123456789abcdef0123456789abcdef0123456789abcdef");

          // Setup request
          final CreateLinodeRequest request = new CreateLinodeRequest();
          request.setTypeId("g5-nanode-1");
          request.setRegionId("us-west-1a")
          request.setLabel("MyLinode");
          request.setGroup("MyLinodeGroup");
          ...

          // Send request and return the newly created Linode
          return this.sender.createLinode(request);
      }
  }
